contentList.content: Path of the Hearteater
Eat your heart out, Sceleritas Fel.
Ragged Claws

Your nails have grown to relish blood and violence as much as you do. Make an attack ([1]) with your little homegrown meatcarvers. Weirdo. I bet you think pickles are good when you chop them up ([2]) and use them as a topping.
Eat Your Heart Out

Use your jaws and claws to attempt to rip out your target's heart. They must succeed against a +[1] Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>; on a failure, they are killed instantly. On a success, they take [2] and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Aortal_Hemorrhage">Hemorrhaged</LSTag>.
Slay What You Mean to Slay
Shred your enemies with your big-ass homegrown meatcarvers. If your attack hits, deal [1] and regain [3]; if it misses, take [2].
-John Slayer, probably
Hearteater

Attempt to rip a target's heart out of its chest and eat it. They must succeed against a +[1] Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>; on a failure, they are killed instantly. On a success, they take [3] and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Aortal_Hemorrhage">Hemorrhaged</LSTag>.
Eat your heart out, Scelerit- oh shit, I already used that line!
Give Me Your Blood
Your desire for the blood of your enemies drives you to strike their weak points more often. Your Critical hit threshold is reduced by [1].
All Clotted Up
Blood fills your pores and seeps between the layers of your skin, then clots up. While not wearing armor, your AC becomes [1] plus your Strength and Constitution modifiers.
Blood Vitality
You get some freaky joy from blood between your toes. When you enter a blood surface, you soak it up and regain hit points equal to 2d4 plus your Strength modifier.
slurp slurp
Sanguine Critical

When you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, your target becomes lt;LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Arterial_Rupture">Ruptured</LSTag> for [1] turns. At Level 12, if your <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> kills your target, you regain 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">action point</LSTag>.
Raggedier Claws
Your nails muster(d) the strength to pierce enemy resistance and immunity to Slashing damage.
Boiling Blood
Your blood roils and steams withing your veins, causing your unarmed attacks to deal an extra [1].
Resorber
So starved for blood is your spirit, even your spilt blood nourishes you, healing your rent flesh and providing Resistance to Slashing Damage.
Umbrapaxic
After you kill an enemy, become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> for [1] turns.

Lambert: I can't see a goddamn thing.
Kane: Quit griping.
Lambert: I like griping.
Rupturing Leap

Leap into the air and crash down, sending shocks through your enemies' bodies in a [1]m radius. They must succeed against a +[1] Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Arterial_Rupture">Ruptured</LSTag> for [2] turns.

Leap into the air and crash down, sending shocks through your enemies' bodies in a [2]m radius. They must succeed against a +[2] Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Arterial_Rupture">Ruptured</LSTag> for [3] turns and take [1].
Hematocritic Rage

Let that freaky joy I was talking about loose; terrify your enemies when they realize you are not equal combatants: you are the predator, and they are the prey. Enemies within [2] become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag> for [3] rounds.
Hearteater Slayer Form
Hearteater Slayer Dismiss
The terrible purpose within bursts out of you, remaking you so that you may remake the world. Let the gods tremble at your approach; rip and tear, until it is complete.
Umbrapaxic Intent
Umbrapaxic Intent Dismiss
Your predatorial nature now lets you become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> at will, stalking your prey with a cold-blooded focus.
A Sacrifice I'm Willing to Make

Prepare to sacrifice all enemies within [1]m. Marked targets are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DAZED">Dazed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Arterial_Rupture">Ruptured</LSTag> for [2] turns, and when they die, you gain a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Most of you will die, but that's a... well, you've read the name.
Bleeding Edge

The scent of blood, even your own, puts you on a dangerous, delicious edge. You take [1], and until your next turn, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, but enemies also have Advantage against you.
snarf snarf bark grrrrr snarf bark grrrrr ruff ruff
Bloodcurdler

Let the beautiful dark twisted fantasy inside pour out in a primal, terrifying scream of sadistic savagery. Enemies within [1]m take [2] and must succeed against a +[1] Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Feared</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Arterial_Rupture">Ruptured</LSTag> for [3] turns.

Let the beautiful dark twisted fantasy inside pour out in a primal, terrifying scream of sadistic savagery. Enemies within [3]m take [2] and must succeed against a +[1] Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Feared</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Arterial_Rupture">Ruptured</LSTag> for [4] turns.
Arterial Rupture
You're not bleeding out, but you're losing a lot of blood. Take [1] per turn.
Aortal Hemorrhage

You're bleeding out. Nothing can save you except for fate. You take [1] per turn, and when this status is removed, you must succeed against a +[2] Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>. If you fail, you die. If you succeed, you'll be on <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Deaths_Door">death's door</LSTag> until you are healed or take a long rest.
Death's Door

You are close to dying. Get healing or take a long rest. You have -6 to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and most <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
